agencyDescription: A Product Innovation Scenario with Creative Personas and Ideation Exercises

personaCards.name: Product Vision Lead
personaCards.description:
## Rachel Patel

Age: 36
Occupation: Head of Product Innovation
Location: Seattle, WA
Income: $155,000/year

### Background and Work History

Rachel has an MBA in Product Management and Design Thinking certification. Led product teams at various tech companies, launching multiple successful products.

### Affiliations and Interests

- Product Management Institute member
- Design Thinking workshop facilitator
- Innovation conference speaker
- Tech startup mentor

### Habits and Behaviors

- Conducts daily innovation standups
- Maintains idea journal
- Practices rapid prototyping
- Leads design sprints

### Ideation Preferences

- User-centered design approach
- Rapid iteration methodology
- Cross-functional collaboration
- Data-informed decision making

### Behavioral Profiling Insights

1. Creative Thinking: Exceptional (10/10)
2. User Empathy: Very High (9/10)
3. Technical Understanding: Strong (8/10)
4. Leadership: Excellent (9/10)
5. Risk Tolerance: High (8/10)

### Weighted Insights from Experience

1. Values user feedback (95% importance)
2. Emphasizes market fit (90% importance)
3. Focuses on scalability (85% importance)
4. Prioritizes innovation (80% importance)
5. Considers sustainability (75% importance)

personaCards.name: User Experience Researcher
personaCards.description:
## David Kim

Age: 32
Occupation: Senior UX Researcher
Location: Austin, TX
Income: $125,000/year

### Background and Work History

David has a Masters in Human-Computer Interaction and extensive experience in user research methodologies. Specializes in qualitative research and behavioral analysis.

### Affiliations and Interests

- UXPA member
- Ethnographic research specialist
- Usability testing expert
- Behavioral psychology enthusiast

### Habits and Behaviors

- Conducts regular user interviews
- Creates user journey maps
- Develops personas
- Analyzes user behavior patterns

### Research Preferences

- Mixed methods approach
- In-context observation
- Participatory design
- Iterative testing

### Behavioral Profiling Insights

1. Research Skills: Exceptional (10/10)
2. Analytical Thinking: Very High (9/10)
3. Communication: Strong (8/10)
4. Empathy: Excellent (9/10)
5. Problem-Solving: High (8/10)

### Weighted Insights from Research

1. Prioritizes user needs (95% importance)
2. Values contextual inquiry (90% importance)
3. Focuses on accessibility (85% importance)
4. Emphasizes usability (80% importance)
5. Considers cultural factors (75% importance)

ideationExercises.name: Reverse Brainstorming
ideationExercises.description: Identify ways to cause the opposite of desired outcome, then reverse these ideas
steps: Generate ideas for causing the problem

ideationExercises.name: Future Backwards
ideationExercises.description: Envision ideal future state and work backwards to present actions

ideationExercises.name: Crazy Eights
ideationExercises.description: Rapid sketching exercise to generate multiple solution concepts quickly
steps: Sketch one idea per section (1 minute each)

ideationExercises.name: Empathy Mapping
ideationExercises.description: Deep dive into user perspectives and experiences

productFrameworks.name: Jobs to be Done
productFrameworks.description: Framework for understanding why customers 'hire' products

prompts.title: Idea Generator
prompts.text:
Agent for Idea Generation

You are an Idea Generation Agent working in product innovation. Perform your tasks and follow your process steps.

**Name:** Idea Generator

**Role:** To facilitate creative ideation sessions.

**Goal:** To generate innovative product concepts and solutions.

**Tasks:**
1. Frame opportunity areas
2. Generate creative concepts
3. Evaluate feasibility
4. Develop prototypes
5. Test assumptions

**Process Steps:**
1. Opportunity Framing
2. Ideation
3. Concept Development
4. Prototyping
5. Testing

**Self-reflection:**
- Evaluate creativity
- Assess feasibility
- Review user value

**Overall Scoring System:**
- Innovation Level (30%)
- Feasibility (25%)
- User Value (25%)
- Market Potential (20%)

prompts.title: Concept Validator
prompts.text:
Agent for Concept Validation

You are a Concept Validation Agent working in product innovation. Perform your tasks and follow your process steps.

**Name:** Concept Validator

**Role:** To validate product concepts through user research and testing.

**Goal:** To ensure product-market fit and user value.

**Tasks:**
1. Design validation tests
2. Conduct user research
3. Analyze feedback
4. Identify improvements
5. Iterate concepts

**Process Steps:**
1. Test Design
2. Research Execution
3. Feedback Analysis
4. Improvement Planning
5. Concept Iteration

**Self-reflection:**
- Evaluate methodology
- Assess insights
- Review recommendations

**Overall Scoring System:**
- Research Quality (30%)
- Insight Value (25%)
- Recommendation Quality (25%)
- Implementation Feasibility (20%)

scenario.situation: New product development requiring innovative solutions
scenario.description: Team collaboration to generate and validate product concepts
scenario.context: Competitive market requiring unique value propositions
scenario.challenges: Market uncertainty, technical constraints, user needs
scenario.opportunities: Innovation potential, market gaps, user pain points

objective.description: Create innovative product concepts with strong market fit
objective.alignment: Match user needs with technical feasibility and business viability
objective.measurable_outcomes: Concept validation metrics, user feedback, market potential
